First off if you've never seen the "Best Little Whore House in Texas" YOU SHOULD. Burt Reynolds and Dolly are hilarious.
 
 Now lets get back to H.R.3590.
 
 1) This "Secretary" is going to be more financialy powerful than than any Czar ever thought of being. He will be able to control funds to states to set up state level offices and and "Research" to track claims.
 
 2)This "Secretary" is going to be able to draw 5 BILLION from the treasury to fund a high risk pool. And if these funds are insufficient he/she can draw out more.
 
 3)If he/she determines that the high risk pool is costing to much then he/she can deny individuals from access.
 
 4)People working for the same company with the same insurance plan with the same coverage are charged more or less depending on their income level.
 
 5)People in the high risk pool can be charged 4-1 depending on age'
 
 These are found in the first 200 pages "10%" of the bill passed by the senate.
